description: HumaNature is the podcast that explores where humans and our habitat meet. The show tells real stories about human experiences in nature. Along the way, we’ll meet people whose encounters help us reflect on our own place in the natural world.
title: HumaNature

episodes.title: Episode 84: Out On The Road
episodes.description: Mikah Meyer grew up the son of a pastor and secretly struggled with his sexuality. But on a record-setting road trip to all of America's national parks, he realized its success hinged on being open about who he was.

episodes.title: Episode 83: The In-Between IV
episodes.description: The leaves are scattering down the sidewalk and fog touches the tips of the trees. It's that time of year again when the shadows lengthen and we bring you stories that aren't quite human or all the way natural. Welcome to a most haunted theatre.

episodes.title: Episode 82: The Afrovivalist
episodes.description: Sharon Ross wanted to be prepared for anything. But when she joined others getting ready for the end of the world, she found herself the odd one out. (more…)

episodes.title: Season 6 Preview
episodes.description: A glimpse of some of the stories coming your way this season, starting October 14. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: The Source
episodes.description: Climate change is all over the news, from burning forests to melting ice sheets. But it can seem like a big, abstract problem. Writer Manasseh Franklin wanted to make the melting of glaciers more real to people. So on an Alaskan rafting trip, she followed water to its source. It’s a story from our archives that’s just as poignant—and humorous—today. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Row Row Row Your Boat. Or Not.
episodes.description: As summer wanes, we’re reaching into the archives for a story about a classic summer activity: a leisurely river float. At least, that’s what it was supposed to be. But when they lost their guide, a group of tourists got more than they bargained for. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Tipping Point
episodes.description: While we work on new stories for this fall, here’s a summer favorite from 2019. Natalie Warren and Ann Raiho paddled thousands of miles in a canoe from Minneapolis to the shores of the Hudson Bay. The journey tested their physical strength – and the strength of their friendship. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 81: The Ghost Of Africa
episodes.description: South Africans Chris Diedericks and Anna Calitz wanted to go on a romantic getaway, but their adventure broke down before it even began. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 80: Starstruck
episodes.description: Juan Martinez grew up in South Central L.A. in the early nineties. He was struggling to find his way until he traded detention for a pack of jalapeño seeds. Those led him all the way to the stars. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 79: The Feeling Of Being Alive
episodes.description: Boyd Varty lives on a game reserve in South Africa near Kruger National Park. After his family began returning the land to its wild state, it awakened something wild in him, too. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 78: Biking On Empty
episodes.description: After cycling across America, Taylor Thibodeau had a lifetime of adventures ahead of him…until a mysterious illness cut that short. Then he decided to adventure anyway. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 77: Morley’s Vision
episodes.description: Morley Nelson delighted in watching raptors in aerial combat as they fought over nesting sites. And he made it his life’s mission to protect the part of Idaho’s Snake River with the highest nesting density of birds of prey in North America. This time, we’re bringing you a story from the new podcast Common Land to tell the story of how the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area was created. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 76: Close Encounters Of The Wild Kind II
episodes.description: It’s springtime and Earth Day! Animals are on the move, and sometimes their paths cross with people. Here are five stories to help you get outside while you’re stuck at home. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 75: Trying To Get Home
episodes.description: Michael Benanav studies nomadic people as a writer and photographer. So when he was invited to accompany the Van Gujjar of northern India on their annual migration with their water buffalo, he jumped at the chance. Turned out, they wanted a journalist along that year for reasons he hadn’t expected. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Hiking Through History
episodes.description: When Tarik Moore became an Outdoor Afro leader, the first hike he planned wasn’t a traditional one. He took his group down city streets to commemorate Philadelphia’s Osage Avenue bombing. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 74: Does A Kid Poop In The Woods?
episodes.description: Cindy Ross wanted to keep pursuing her long-distance hiking passion after she had kids. But she didn’t know how to make that happen. Then a chance encounter with a llama breeder opened the path to the Continental Divide Trail. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 73: Not Healed, But Healing
episodes.description:
Brandon Kuehn survived the Iraq War. But after he got home, he struggled with nightmares and addiction. Then he found trail running…and the Pacific Crest Trail.

 

 

If you like HumaNature, help us tell more stories! Support us at https://donate.nprstations.org/wpr/humanature.

You can also follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/HumaNaturePod, Instagram https://www.instagram.com/humanaturepodcast, and Facebook https://www.facebook.com/HumaNaturePodcast. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 72: Everyone Needs A Purpose
episodes.description:
Christopher McDougall is famous for starting the barefoot running craze with his book ‘Born to Run.’ And now he has an unusual new running partner⁠—a donkey named Sherman.

 

 

If you like HumaNature, help us tell more stories! Support us at https://donate.nprstations.org/wpr/humanature.

You can also follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/HumaNaturePod, Instagram https://www.instagram.com/humanaturepodcast, and Facebook https://www.facebook.com/HumaNaturePodcast. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus: Moose Surprise
episodes.description:
We have a snazzy new t-shirt design for you. But it isn’t without a little controversy.

 

Support This Podcast

If you like HumaNature, help us tell more stories! Support us at https://donate.nprstations.org/wpr/humanature.

You can also follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/HumaNaturePod, Instagram https://www.instagram.com/humanaturepodcast, and Facebook https://www.facebook.com/HumaNaturePodcast.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 71: The Summit
episodes.description: Tarik Moore always enjoyed nature. So when he found an outdoorsy community, it led to new adventures—like becoming a member of the first all-Black American team to summit Mt. Kilimanjaro. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 70: Through Oliver’s Eyes
episodes.description: When Wendy Hellowell’s son Oliver was born, he was diagnosed with Down syndrome. She realized the two of them would face enormous challenges. But they got help from a little faith and a camera. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 69: Brain On Nature
episodes.description: We’re taking a little break for the holidays, so we have a special treat for you from down under. The Australian podcast Brain on Nature tells the story of how going into nature helped a woman recover from a traumatic brain injury. We hope you love the show as much as we do! (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Why Elephants Never Forget
episodes.description: As you feast on podcasts during the holidays, here’s a second helping of an old favorite. Aubrey Bertram traveled to East Asia to help animals that had been abused by humans. But a harrowing experience taught her that good intentions might not be enough. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 68: All The World’s A Deer Stand
episodes.description: Fisher Neal was a struggling actor in New York City. So he turned to his old hunting skills for a side job extremely off-Broadway. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 67: The In-Between III
episodes.description: A burned-bare house. A pervy spirit. The ghost of Schafer Meadows. A haunted woman. It’s our annual Halloween episode—keep your friends close and your lights on as we find the place that’s not quite human or all the way natural. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 66: The Secret Of The Adirondack Lean-tos
episodes.description: Jeff Osgood and his friend Anthony just wanted to go on a winter hiking trip in the Adirondack Wilderness in upstate New York. But after a series of mishaps, their adventure took a strange turn with the discovery of a mysterious VHS cassette tape. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 65: Deserted
episodes.description: Josh Patterson loved taking photographs of rare finds in the Mojave Desert. But on one trip, things didn’t go as planned. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 64: Migrations
episodes.description: Caroline Van Hemert and her husband Pat were nearly finished with the most ambitious trip of their lives, a 4000-mile trek across the Yukon and Alaska following animal migrations. But bad weather and a missed food drop put their lives in jeopardy. (more…)

episodes.title: Season 5 Preview
episodes.description: HumaNature returns on September 11 with a new season of stories where humans and our habitat meet. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 63: Impermafrost
episodes.description: All across the Arctic, frozen soil is thawing out. A lot of stuff is buried there – plants and animals that lived more than 10,000 years ago. This episode from Threshold asks what happens when a Paleolithic bison bone starts to decompose for the first time? And what does that have to do with climate change? (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Time Bomb
episodes.description: For her final episode as the host of HumaNature, Caroline has chosen an old favorite. Brian Corliss just wanted to quench his thirst. But on a snowmobile outing, he grabbed the wrong bottle. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 62: Lost Bearings
episodes.description: Curt Meyer was looking for adventure, so he took a job aboard a Japanese fishing trawler on the Bering Sea. But when a storm hit, the lack of a shared language kept him in the dark as things turned deadly. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 61: Tipping Point
episodes.description: Natalie Warren and Ann Raiho paddled thousands of miles in a canoe from Minneapolis to the shores of the Hudson Bay. The journey tested their physical strength – and the strength of their friendship. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Carbon And Dust
episodes.description: An encore presentation of our 2019 PMJA Best Station Podcast award-winner. Felicia Friesema and Steve Julian had a “miracle relationship.” They carved out an oasis in the middle of Los Angeles. But then they found themselves facing one of the most fundamental aspects of nature: death. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 60: The Source
episodes.description: Manasseh Franklin wanted to make the melting of glaciers more real to people through her writing. So on an Alaskan rafting trip, she followed water to its source. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 59: Vicious And Viral
episodes.description: Travis Kauffman went for a trail run near his home in Colorado. But an unexpected run-in almost turned him into trail mix. Then the internet got involved. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 58: Close Encounters Of The Wild Kind
episodes.description: It’s spring! Animals are on the move, and sometimes their paths cross with people. Here are four stories. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 57: Forest Bathing
episodes.description: When she became a mom, Andrea Sarubbi Fereshteh went from full speed ahead to a full stop. But then she found a place that showed her stillness is okay. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 56: The Shuidong Connection
episodes.description: In 2016, a team of undercover investigators infiltrated an international ivory-smuggling ring. It all began with a sea cucumber trader in Zanzibar. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 55 Part 1: The Sinking Of The Blythe Star
episodes.description: For this special two-part story, the Australian podcast Off Track takes us across the globe to the coast of Tasmania and back in time to 1973 for a story of survival and loss. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 55 Part 2: The Sinking Of The Blythe Star
episodes.description: For this special two-part story, the Australian podcast Off Track takes us across the globe to the coast of Tasmania and back in time to 1973 for a story of survival and loss. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 54: A Life For Science
episodes.description: Sergio Avila Villegas always loved big cats. But his faith in his scientific research was shaken when he discovered its true cost. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 53: We’re Thru-(Hike)
episodes.description: Emily Pennington was super in love with her boyfriend. But a backpacking trip put that to the test. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 52: A Positive Experience!
episodes.description: Monty Hudson wanted his daughter, Siena, to have a good time on her first backpacking trip. But things didn’t go according to plan. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 51: The Water At The Roof Of The World
episodes.description: Wang Ping wanted to go to Tibet to bless the world. But to do that, she had to risk her own safety. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 50: Witness
episodes.description: Gayle Woodsum finally found a safe place in the remote Rocky Mountains. But when an oil rig moved in, she wondered how safe it was after all. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Finding The Way Home In A Purple Canoe
episodes.description:
While we’re putting the finishing touches on a great new release, here’s a rescored episode from Season 1.Patrick Dobsonwas stuck in his life, so he decided to take a trip by canoe from Montana to Missouri. Only he had never canoed before.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 49: Murphy’s Law
episodes.description: Marty Edwards wanted to go on a fun trip with his girlfriend. But Mother Nature had other plans. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 48: The In-Between II
episodes.description: A haunted shop. An interview with spirits. A protective force field. It’s the time of year when the shadows lengthen and we bring you stories that aren’t quite natural and aren’t all the way human. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 47: Protector
episodes.description: Miho Aida wanted to tell unheard stories about the outdoors. So she set out on a bicycle to promote her documentary about the people who live in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. But when she encountered a different point of view, she found she had to listen, too.  (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Catch And Release
episodes.description:
Here’s a re-scored episode from Season 1. Tonia Hanson had a secret. But when a private river retreat turned out to be very, very public, Tonia found unexpected healing.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 46: Sanctuary
episodes.description: In 2012, 30 wolves and wolf-dogs were living at W.O.L.F. Sanctuary in northern Colorado. But one sunny June morning, a massive wildfire closed in on their mountain home. (more…)

episodes.title: The Event Horizon Part 3: Death
episodes.description: To Alua Arthur, life made no sense. But then she began to make sense of death. (more…)

episodes.title: The Event Horizon Part 2: Creativity
episodes.description: If creative and destructive forces are linked, what does this say about artists, or mothers, or god? (more…)

episodes.title: The Event Horizon Part 1: Black Hole
episodes.description: This is the first part of a three-part series on creation and destruction. Black holes are the most destructive force in the universe. But what if they’re also creative? (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Through The Keyhole
episodes.description: An encore presentation of our 2018 PMJA Best Station Podcast award-winner. Tyler Dunning went into the wild to distract himself from his grief…but ended up coming face to face with it instead. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 45: Remembering How To Be Human
episodes.description: After almost a decade making art in New York City, Stephanie Housley craved being closer to nature, her source of inspiration. So she moved to Bondurant, Wyoming – population 93. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 44: The Elephant Guardian
episodes.description: When Patrick Kilonzo Mwalua saw wild animals suffering from drought, he decided it was his responsibility to bring them water. (more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: Hoofprints On The Heart
episodes.description: Here’s a re-scored take on one of our all-time favorite episodes. It’s the story of a love that spans continents. Jon Dunham set out on the longest, toughest walk of his life. But along the way, he met someone who helped carry the weight. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 43: Dogs On A Plane
episodes.description: When Paul Steklenski got his pilot’s license, he didn’t just want to fly to lunch. Instead, he flew to the pound. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 42: Out Of The Frying Pan
episodes.description: Cheryl and Greg left Portland, Oregon, one hot summer for the cool of the mountains. But that put them out of the frying pan and into the fire. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 41: Carbon And Dust
episodes.description: Felicia Friesema and Steve Julian had a “miracle relationship.” They carved out an oasis in the middle of Los Angeles. But then they found themselves facing one of the most fundamental aspects of nature: death. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 40: Her Legacy
episodes.description: This episode is about what we do that leaves a mark: the visible impact we leave behind on the country we live in and the countries we visit. Another podcast we admire, She Explores, takes us to Torres del Paine National Park in Patagonia. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 39: Junk
episodes.description:
Marcus Eriksen wanted to draw attention to a problem no one could see. So he sailed into the middle of it.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 38: The Hunt
episodes.description:
Jessi Johnson is a modern-day Artemis. But the perfect shot led her on a heartbreaking odyssey.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 37: Crispy Crickets, Not Your Spin Instructor’s Paleo
episodes.description:
The paleo diet aims to take nutrition back to the basics—to the way Paleolithic people ate. But prehistoric people didn’t eat boneless chicken breasts and pre-washed baby spring mix. Tory Taylor set out to discover what folks really ate thousands of years ago.

(more…)

episodes.title: Extra: Hurricane Of The Heart
episodes.description:
It was 2012. Caroline was in love. But then heartbreak washed over her, like the storm surge from Hurricane Sandy.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 36: The Oregon Trailblazer
episodes.description: In 2011, Rinker Buck crossed the Oregon Trail — yes, that Oregon Trail — in a covered wagon pulled by a team of mules. He traveled with his brother Nick and a Jack Russell Terrier named Olive Oyl. The journey forced Rinker to confront his greatest fear. (more…)

episodes.title: Extra: “What Is Grain Alcohol, And Where Can I Get Some?”
episodes.description: As we discovered in Episode 35, sometimes grain alcohol is the solution, not the problem. For Sandra Jones, it was a bit of both. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 35: Time Bomb
episodes.description:
Brian Corliss just wanted to quench his thirst. But on a snowmobile outing, he grabbed the wrong bottle. *Disclaimer: The actions taken in this story do not constitute medical advice. In the case of poisoning, call Poison Control at (800) 222-1222.

(more…)

episodes.title: Extra: “Watch Out For the Damn Horny Toads!” And Other Thoughts On Not Having Enough
episodes.description:
In 2017, the Great American Eclipse drew thousands of spectators to otherwise wild and desolate spots in Wyoming. For writer Liberty Lausterer, this was a cause for concern.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 34: The Law Of Gravity
episodes.description:
Bruce Smith was on a routine helicopter flight in the remote Wind River Mountains. But what goes up must come down…one way or another.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 33: Ten Steps
episodes.description: On December 22, 2016, Karen Klein got trapped in a snowstorm near the Grand Canyon. But she pushed through it to save her family. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 32: Trash Bandits And Border Collies
episodes.description:
Maggie had it all: a fine house, a loving family, and a big yard. But she threw it all away for adventure. And when things got bad, she had to use her wits.

(more…)

episodes.title: Bonus Episode: It’s All Downwind From Here
episodes.description: For your Thanksgiving podcast binge, here’s a second helping of an older episode. Sophie May grew up in Alaska, spending lots of time outside. But when it came time to explore the wilderness as an adult, she found out she had more to learn. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 31: Why Elephants Never Forget
episodes.description: Aubrey Bertram traveled to East Asia to help animals that had been abused by humans. But a harrowing experience taught her that good intentions might not be enough. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 30: The In-Between
episodes.description: A possessed basement. A magic mirror. A shop of spirits. Mysterious lights where they don’t belong. Gather around the campfire as we open the portal to a place that isn’t quite human or all the way natural. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 29: Parks And Scandinavian Recreation
episodes.description: Linda McGurk wanted her children to love the outdoors, just like she did as a little girl in Sweden. But when she moved to the U.S., she found out it wasn’t quite that simple. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 28: Things That Go Squeak In The Night
episodes.description: When the Massaro family traded life on dry land for a life at sea, they encountered some unexpected company.  (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 27: What Her Cells Knew
episodes.description: Lucy came face-to-face with a family secret that upended her life. So she seized the moment. (more…)

episodes.title: Season 3 Preview
episodes.description: Season 3 of HumaNature takes to the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, the middle of an Indiana creek, and into one woman’s DNA. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 26: Surviving Mom
episodes.description: In this episode, we’re excited to introduce you to a great storytelling podcast from Montana, Last Best Stories. Two friends were on a hike in Glacier National Park when a pair of fuzzy, cuddly-looking grizzly cubs crossed their path. But they knew momma bear wouldn’t be far away. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 25: Ordinary Giants
episodes.description: Science journalist Lynda Mapes takes us deep into a New England forest, where one tree is telling the story of climate change. This is the final episode of our summer series, Science Camp, where we’re exploring the human side of science. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 24: Bearded Ladies
episodes.description: This is the second episode in our three-part Science Camp series, where we’re exploring the human side of science. Paleobotanist Ellen Currano noticed a lack of other women in her field. So she decided to dress up as a man. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 23: Between A Rock And A Holy Place
episodes.description:
This is the first episode in a three-part summer series, called Science Camp, where we’re exploring the human side of science. Ryan Haupt had a lot of questions about his faith. When he started looking for answers, he unearthed them in unexpected places.

(more…)

episodes.title: Summer Series Preview
episodes.description:
We’re starting a new three-part summer series on June 21: Science Camp, where we explore the human side of science.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 22: Through The Keyhole
episodes.description:
Tyler Dunning went into the wild to distract himself from his grief…but ended up coming face to face with it instead.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 21: Running For Your Life
episodes.description: After breaking his back, doctors told Gary Havener he would never walk again. So…he decided to run. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 20: Dogs Are People, Too
episodes.description:
In 2007, more than 50 pit bulls were discovered at a dogfighting ring in Virginia. Most people thought they couldn’t be saved. But their stories had just begun.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 19: Freedom
episodes.description: 150 years ago, two girls crossed the Missouri River trying to escape a life of slavery. In the summer of 2016, Barry Jurgensen set out on a 500-mile journey to follow in their footsteps. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 18: Go Tell It In The Desert
episodes.description: Arik was burning to share his faith with the world. But the people he thought needed his message the most weren’t interested in what he had to say. And the camels weren’t, either.

episodes.title: Episode 17: The Ents Of Melbourne
episodes.description: Melbourne, Australia wanted its residents to help keep an eye on its trees. So they gave every tree an email address. But then the trees started to write back. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 16: Amy And The Animals
episodes.description: It was November 9, 2016. Amy was worried about the new political landscape. But some unusual encounters at work gave her fresh perspective. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 15: The Young Man Of The Mountain
episodes.description: In this episode, we’ll introduce you to another outdoor show we really like…New Hampshire Public Radio’s Outside/In. 12-year-old Tyler Armstrong was on a quest to climb Mount Everest, but he had people wondering: how young is too young to climb Mount Everest? (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 14: It’s All Downwind From Here
episodes.description: Sophie May grew up in Alaska, spending lots of time outside. But when it came time to explore the wilderness as an adult, she found out she had more to learn. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 13: Bigfoot
episodes.description: For our 13th episode, we venture off the beaten path to hear about Bigfoot and the scientist who’s on a mission to find him.  (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 12: Home On The Waves With A Seafaring Cowboy
episodes.description:
Herb Pownall wanted to see the world. So he boarded a ship bound for Europe…along with 800 cows.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 11: Hoofprints On The Heart
episodes.description: This is the story of a love that spans continents. Jon Dunham set out on the longest, toughest walk of his life. But along the way, he met someone who helped carry the weight.  (more…)

episodes.title: Season 1 Recap
episodes.description:
Caroline and Micah reminisce about how HumaNature’s first season came about. And they play a part of the never-before-heard pilot episode. Fire up your grill(e)!

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 10: The Moon And The Possum
episodes.description: Where do we come from? And where do we go when we die? Paul Taylor shares one of the oldest answers to those questions.  (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 9: May The Road Rise Up To Meet You, And May The Wind Stop Blowing In Your Face
episodes.description: Christina Lee should have been having the time of her life. Instead, she was stressed and lonely. Until she decided to run away from the rat race…all the way from New York to San Francisco. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 8: Row Row Row Your Boat. Or Not.
episodes.description: It was supposed to be a leisurely float down the Snake River. But when they lost their guide, a group of tourists got more than they bargained for. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 7: Man vs. Machine
episodes.description: Micah Schweizer was skiing in the back-country when he uttered a curse against snowmobilers. But you know what they say—be careful what you wish for. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 6: In The Beginning, God Created The Heavens And The Earth And The Allosaurus
episodes.description:
Erin Jonesthought the answers were written in stone. But a summer internship at a remote dinosaur quarry eroded her certainty.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 5: Finding The Way Home In A Purple Canoe
episodes.description:
Patrick Dobsonwas stuck in his life, so he decided to take a trip by canoe from Montana to Missouri. Only he had never canoed before.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 4: Catch And Release
episodes.description:
Tonia Hanson had a secret. But when a private river retreat turned out to be very, very public, Tonia found unexpected healing.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 3: When A Search And Rescue Becomes A Search For Something Else
episodes.description:
Greg Ley was deep in the Rocky Mountains, training as an outdoor guide, when his group encountered tragedy. What happened next forever changed his beliefs about the importance of humans to the wilderness. Winner of a 2016 PMJA Best Station Podcast award.

(more…)

episodes.title: Episode 2: A Ballroom Dancer, A Shark, And A PR Problem
episodes.description: Debbie Salamone was an environmental journalist who was passionate about the ocean—and ballroom dancing. One day at the beach, all that changed. (more…)

episodes.title: Episode 1: Up A River, Without… A Pigeon?
episodes.description: Charlie Thomas worked as a whitewater rafting guide in the 80s. His boss became obsessed with selling photos of clients taken while they ran the rapids. The only problem was getting the film back across the river and into town to be developed before the clients returned. (more…)
